string-array.item: METRICON brings you a free cooking class online
Australia out of the new crown detection device launched 3 million Novavax vaccine arrived in the notice
In need of advice? Meet our friendly DUSA Advocates as you grab a free brekky on campus!
How water can help you manage anxiety
Don’t shy away from critique – learn how to turn feedback into better marks
Have you done a good deed today? Here’s why simple acts of kindness can boost your wellbeing

string-array.name: newsDetail
string-array.item: Now is a busy time for submitting assignments and receiving feedback on your work.
Sometimes we are delighted by the marker feedback we get on assignments, and other times it can be upsetting;
you might feel a bit confused if you receive suggestions for improvement you weren’t expecting, or that you don’t fully understand.
Remember: understanding feedback is the key to academic success, so think of it as a learning opportunity, not an obstacle
Here are a few tips for making effective use of the feedback you receive while you’re studying online, including seeking further advice if you need more help
It includes interactive tools, videos and podcasts that can enhance relaxation, focus, energy, mood and productivity in minutes.
Challenge yourself to do three random acts of kindness over a week and note how they make you feel via your personalised app profile
